DOC.brief_title: Does Nightly Dexmedetomidine Improve Sleep Reduce Delirium ICU Patients ?
DOC.detailed_description: The goal study determine whether nocturnal protocol incorporate pharmacologic intervention associate improved sleep ( i.e . dexmedetomidine ) improve sleep quality reduce incidence delirium sub-syndromal delirium critically ill patient ventilator setting optimize optimize sleep quality . 1 . To evaluate impact dexmedetomidine-focussed nocturnal sleep protocol minimize arousal sleep : 1. incidence delirium [ Intensive Care Delirium Screening Checklist ( ICDSC ) score ≥ 4 ] 2. incidence sub-syndromal delirium ( ICDSC score 1-3 ) 3. outcome specifically define place discharge hospital ( i.e. , home , rehabilitation , long-term care ) 2 . To gain understanding effect night-time sedation dexmedetomidine : 1. patient safety 2. self-reported sleep quality 3. sleep quality architecture [ base subgroup 10 patient Tufts Medical Center evaluate use polysomnography ( PSG ) one night ] 4. time spend within target sedation goal 5. time spend without pain 6. agitation-related event 7. length stay ICU 8. duration mechanical ventilation 9. length hospital stay 10. total health care cost measure medication cost hospitalization cost , well calculate effectiveness ( sleep , sedation pain management vs. cost ) . This multicenter study perform : 1 . Hopital Maissonneuve Rosemont , Montreal , PQ 2 . Tufts Medical Center , Boston , MA
